title: American flag indicator for top 10 artists on Artist Leaderboard

requirements.summary: Show an inline American flag icon next to the artist name for ranks 1–10 in both mobile and desktop ArtistRow layouts without changing existing row behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: For artists with rank 1–10, an American flag icon is visible next to (or immediately before) the artist name on both mobile and desktop layouts.
For artists with rank > 10 (if present in the future), the flag indicator is not shown.
Existing row content remains intact: rank badge, avatar, artist name, Reach Score, RankShiftIndicator, and HypeBadge behavior all remain present and functional.

file_operations.description: Add a rank-based (rank <= 10) inline flag indicator rendered alongside the artist name in both the mobile and desktop name rows, ensuring existing rank/avatar/Reach Score/RankShiftIndicator/HypeBadge structure and behavior remain unchanged; reference the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/us-flag-icon.dim_64x48.png and size it for row-level readability.

requirements.summary: Implement the American flag indicator as a generated non-photo static frontend asset served locally from the public generated assets folder.
acceptanceCriteria: The American flag shown for ranks 1–10 uses a generated static image placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced by a stable local path (no remote/photo URLs).
The flag asset renders crisply at small sizes (row-level icon) and remains readable on the existing light-blue mandala background.
No new photo-based images are introduced for the flag indicator.

file_operations.description: Add the generated flat (non-photo) American flag icon asset at this exact path for local static serving and crisp small-size rendering.

Ensure the flag indicator uses the local generated asset (frontend/public/assets/generated/us-flag-icon.dim_64x48.png) with appropriate dimensions/alt text and no remote/photo URLs, maintaining clarity against the mandala background.
